title: Third victim reportedly dies after Pawtucket ice rink shooting
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Gerald Dorgan, 75, died after being critically injured in the February 16 Pawtucket ice rink shooting, making him the third fatality.
The shooting at Dennis M. Lynch Arena occurred during a high school hockey game, targeting Robert Dorgan's ex-wife and son.
Gerald's daughter Rhonda and grandson Aidan were also killed; the shooter died from a self-inflicted gunshot wound.

title: Cat saved after days stuck in a tree following the blizzard that blanketed Rhode Island
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Matt Lyons climbed 40-50 feet to rescue a cat stuck in a tree during Rhode Island's blizzard.
Pixie, the cat, was trapped in the tree for nearly two days amidst historic snowstorm conditions.
After seeing a post on Nextdoor, Lyons decided to help, successfully saving Pixie and reuniting her with her owner.

title: 4 questions facing Bruins as they return from Olympic break
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Bruins resume play with a matchup against the Columbus Blue Jackets at TD Garden after a nearly three-week break.
Boston's penalty killing unit ranks 28th in the league, with only a 76.4% success rate, presenting a major flaw.
The Bruins are considering trade options ahead of the March 6 deadline, with potential interest in long-term assets.

title: Fire erupts at MCI-Norfolk prison, no major injuries reported
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: A fire occurred at MCI-Norfolk prison, with the Norfolk Fire Department responding around 1:30 p.m. Wednesday.
Three incarcerated individuals treated for smoke inhalation, and a staff member went to the hospital for evaluation.
Officials are investigating the fire cause and assessing damage at the medium-security facility.

title: Stephen A. Smith endorses Jaylen Brown as an MVP candidate
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stephen A. Smith supports Jaylen Brown for NBA MVP due to his performance during Jayson Tatum's injury.
Boston Celtics hold second place in the Eastern Conference with a 38-19 record, defying low preseason expectations.
Jaylen Brown averages 29.2 points, 7.0 rebounds, and 4.9 assists per game, leading Boston in Tatum's absence.

title: Harvard professor on leave as college investigates ties to Jeffrey Epstein
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Harvard professor Martin Nowak placed on leave amid investigation of ties to Jeffrey Epstein.
Nowak received $6.5 million from Epstein, visited Epstein's island, and provided him an office at Harvard.
Former Harvard president Larry Summers resigned over close relationship with Epstein shown in DOJ documents.

title: Malden educator, basketball coach charged with rape in incident involving high school student, officials say
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Malden educator and basketball coach Scott Marino was charged with rape and placed on leave after an alleged incident.
Marino faces two counts of rape and additional charges including indecent assault and selling liquor to a minor.
The incident involved a Malden High School student and occurred outside working hours, according to Superintendent Timothy Sippel.

title: Red Sox’ Wilyer Abreu explains viral broken-bat check swing
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Wilyer Abreu's bat broke during a check swing in a game against Pittsburgh, becoming a viral social media moment.
Abreu speculated that a prior at-bat ground ball might have weakened the bat, despite confirming no damage before reusing it.
In 2025, Abreu hit 22 home runs and earned a Golden Glove, despite being limited to 115 games due to injuries.

title: All Mass. customers should have power fully restored by end of Friday night, Eversource says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Eversource plans to restore power by midnight Friday for 160,000 customers affected by Monday's blizzard in Eastern Massachusetts.
Cape Cod and Martha’s Vineyard have 121,000 outages, while Plymouth and New Bedford face 40,000, expected resolved by Friday.
Eversource brought in crews from Canada, New Hampshire, and Ohio; workers are on 18-hour shifts to address outages.

title: Team USA captain Hilary Knight reacts to Trump’s ‘distasteful’ joke about U.S. women’s hockey team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hilary Knight criticized Trump's joke about the U.S. women's hockey team as distasteful, overshadowing their Olympic achievements.
Both the U.S. men’s and women’s hockey teams won gold at the 2026 Winter Olympics, defeating Canada 2-1 in overtime.
The U.S. women's team declined Trump's State of the Union invitation, citing academic and professional commitments post-Games.
